name: Magic: The Gathering
premise: Two or more players are engaged in a battle as powerful wizards called 'Planeswalkers'.
description: Magic: The Gathering (MTG) is a collectible and digital collectible card game created by mathematics professor Richard Garfield and published by Wizards of the Coast.
total_playtime_notes: Playtime varies greatly depending on the number of players and the complexity of the deck.
session_playtime_notes: A single session typically lasts between 30 to 45 minutes.
immersiveness_level_notes: The fantasy theme and complex gameplay can be quite immersive for players.
learning_curve_notes: MTG has many rules and intricate strategies, which can be challenging for new players.
save_mechanism_notes: Not applicable for this type of game.
how_to_win: Reduce your opponent's life total to zero.

reasons: The game involves strategic thinking and planning.
There is a competitive player community.
The game has deep strategic elements.
There is a lot of variety in gameplay.

setup.footprint_notes: Requires only enough space to lay out cards.
setup.time_notes: Includes shuffling and drawing initial hand.
setup.complexity_notes: Setup is relatively simple, but gameplay can be complex.

rule_complexity_notes: MTG has a complex rulebook and many card-specific rules.
mastery_curve_notes: Becoming proficient requires understanding of the game's extensive card library and strategies.
additional_notes: Magic: The Gathering is notable for its deep strategic gameplay and dedicated player base.
unique_selling_point: Deep strategic gameplay with a vast library of unique cards.
